text: Draft - Has a sweet smell to it like maple. Huge amounts of coffee and dark chocolate. Not very bitter but certainly dry and meaty on the palate. Dark cherry as well.

On tap @ Wrecking Bar. Black pour with a small tan head. Big time coffee aroma here. Quite impressive, though it does kind of drown out a lot of the other characteristics. Somewhat heavy on the cocoa/chocolate notes still. A nice bit of roast, some mild sweetness of dark fruits and toffee. Just a touch spicy as well. Pretty nice.
Black with tan head coffee and caramelized malts in aroma. Taste cocoa and rich dark malts. Finished nice and chewy. Some hop present on finish.
Really enjoyed this one. Smells like coffee and smoked meat, with some dark cocoa. Taste is very rich, lots of espresso and dark chocolate and smokey flavors. Really nice stuff.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a deep black with some cola highlights on the edges under a medium sized dense tan head. Sweet roast and coffee with chocolate and a bit of dark fruit. Medium bodied, cocoa and chocolate with a big coffee kick. Lingering coffee on the finish, earthy and bitter.

Sample at GABF 10/04/2014, thanks to my BIL for assistance with note-taking. Pours black with a medium khaki head that dissipates gradually. Patchy lacing. Aroma of coffee, malt and chocolate. Light to medium body with flavors of roasted coffee, chocolate malt and vanilla. The finish is roasty with a vanilla coffee aftertaste. Pretty good all around.
Black pour. Small tan head. Little bit of lacing. Nice creamy coffee aroma with hints of vanilla and caramel. Nice coffee flavor. Chocolate and caramel.
Black pour. Brown head. Coffee galore! Roast, chocolate, creamy, simply delicious. I could drink this from a mug in the AM.

On tap. Pours near black with smallish tan head. Aroma is roast, coffee and chocolate. Similar taste with some ripe fruit notes peeking through. Full creamy mouthfeel. Very nice stout. Looking forward to getting down to the brewpub to try some more of their stuff.

On tap at the Distillery. Pours black with a small light tan head. Aroma of rich roasted malt, sweet malt, booze, vanilla. Flavor of roasted malt, chocolate, booze. I dont get much coffee, if at all. A sweet, rich imperial stout. Decent.
6/4/6/4/13 (3.3/5)
Draught. This is a nice thick stout with a hint of coffee that is not overpowering. Well balanced.

Appearance is black with a tan head. Aroma is filled with chocolate, coffee, oatmeal, and espresso. Flavor is awesome with some espresso, dark chocolate, and cream. The finish is slightly sweet. Overall dear god man
On tap at the brewpub. The base version is good, but the added coffee makes it great! The dark fruit really comes out, and the coffee somehow makes it far less earthy.

Draft at Sweet Grass Dairy. Black pour with a thick creamy tan head. Huge coffee aroma, dark chocolate, earth, soil and roasted maltiness. Flavor is chocolate and coffee driven with roasted malts, earthiness with bitter piney hops in the background. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Nice stuff.

Snifter pour at the Wrecking Bar. Had with desert. Deep brown, almost black oily pour. No head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate. cocoa nibs, and vanilla. Taste of dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and vanilla. Very full body. Oily, coffee finish. Very good.

Tap from Lazy Dog. Pours a deep dark brown with a bit of toffee colored head. Aroma of chocolate and coffee with subtle hints of peanut butter. Taste upfront of roasted coffee that fades into a more chocolate taste.

Draft at source. Oily black pour. Aroma is fairly intense coffee, dark malts, and coffee. Big and chewy, a bit of a sipper even with a relatively low ABV. Very nice introduction to Wrecking Bar beers. 
(from notes)

Draft at the brewery with linh, scarlett, and mom. Pours a deep black body with thin off white lacing. Aroma is deliciously sweet espresso and light roast. Mouthfeel is medium to thin with notes of espresso, sugar and sweet roast.

Pours dark black with thin creamy mocha head. Smell is mild coffee, taste is coffee, cocoa, roasted malts. Smooth easy drinking coffee stout. Palate could use a touch more body for my tastes but very nice otherwise.
On tap at the pub. Maybe one of the strongest and purest coffee flavornive had in a beer. Lip smakingly sweet on the finish. Cocoa and bittersweet coffee dominate.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2013 I am a bit embarrassed that this was my first trip over to the Wrecking Bar.  The ambiance was as good as described by friends, and thus, I was excited to give their beers a try.  This poured dark brown with a brown head.  If a good coffee stout is infused with shade grown fair trade, this was Maxwell House.  Light on flavor.  Might benefit from a bit more alcoholic punch.   I will give it another try in the future, but tonight it just wasnt my cup of tea (pun intended).  Draft - Wrecking Bar - Atlanta, GA

On tap at brewpub. Pours near black tan head. Aromas of roasted malts, chocolate, and fair amount of sweet espresso. Flavors of nicely roasted malt, chocolate undertones, nice sweet espresso touch, and some hop bitterness to bring in the balance. Finishes with coffee lingering on the tongue. Pretty solid coffee stout.
Black brown pour with creamy dark tan  head and lace. Hard coffee aroma. Hard coffee, roasted malt, and a hinto chocolate. Medium/full bodied with smooth carbonation.

Pours a rich black sable with a fairly thick and fine-bubbled dark tan head that leaves generous lacing. Hearty roast malt aroma has a robust coffee overtone - high quality coffee, that is! Flavor has strong quality coffee and roast malt notes with hints of brown sugar and licorice. Almost like drinking a good cuppa from Caribou Coffee! Firm texture has plenty of fizz, leaving a quality coffee finish. You like coffee and beer, try this one.
From tap at the brewpub. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is smooth coffee, chocolate and liqourice. Smooth coffee and dark malty flavoured into a dry and roasted malty finish.
Brewvival Trip Beer 48. Draft at the brewpub. Pours a dark brown color with a large creamy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of bitter roasted malts, coffee, faint hops. Medium bodied. Nice.
Draft at the source. Black color, brown head. Aroma of freshly ground coffee. Taste is sweet caffe macchiato and cocoa powder. Tasty.

tap poured an almost black beverage with a smooth creamy average sized tan head that was mostly lasting and left great lacing on the glass. The aroma was big. There were prominent notes of roasted barley and cherries with more subtle hints of leather, grass and molasses. The body was medium with a slightly sharp carbonation and a somewhat watery texture. The flavor starts lightly bitter and the bitterness grows through the middle to a moderate level and then stays there through the medium finish
Black with light off-white lacing. Aroma-like sticking your nose into a bag of coffee beans. Yum. Black coffee on a rich, robust palate. Oh yeah, id drink this for breakfast!
On tap at Wrecking Bar.  Nose has all the nice roast and chocolate of the regular Jemmy Stout, but with a very nice infusion of coffee.  Great blend of base and additive; extremely smooth.
Black color with tan head.  Awesome mocha, espresso, dark chocolate aromas. Smooth medium body. Mocha, espresso, dark roast flavors with a semi dry finish--very good
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Half pint on tap at the brewpub. Pours black with a brown head that lasts throughout the beer. Aroma has a good amount of roasted malts with a bit of dry coffee and a good amount of bitterness. Flavor begins with roasted malts and dark chocolate and is joined by a bitter coffee note with a hint of underlying sweetness.
I liked the Jemmy Stout, and this twist did not screw it up. This probably isnt a dry stout, but its relatively dry. Nice roasty malts blend perfectly with the coffee. Not ashy at all.
8 oz. draftbpours a black color with a tan head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, dark roasted malt.  Full bodied, nicely balanced

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2012 
Name: Jemmy
Date: February 19, 2012
Mode: Draft
Source: Brewpub
Appearance: opaque black, frothy tan head, solid lace
Aroma: sweet chocolate aroma, touch of roasted coffee
Flavor: rich roasted malt flavor, good dose of coffee balanced with the roasted malt so that neither dominates, bitter dark chocolate, touch of caramel sweetness grows as it warms, long bitter finish
Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 15/20
Rating: 3.6/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: *** /4

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2012 Very good use of coffee to complement and expand original beer. Pleasant aroma, though not as prominent as expected from coffee. Mouthfeel a tad thin and fizzy but still enjoyable, a nice change from some thicker, more sticky or oily stouts. Well balanced flavor very crisp and tasty coffee, even has a coffeeish bitterness as glass empties.
